render.tex: \title{Vector (Cross) Product} \\ %text Vector multiplication of two vectors %

reason.tex: %text The cross-product of two non-zero vectors is a{\bf vector} which is{\bf perpendicular} to the plane containing the original vectors. It is given by the following equation. % \begin{align} \ora{A}&=\vector{a_1}{a_2}{a_3} \\ \ora{B}&=\vector{b_1}{b_2}{b_3} \\ \ora{A}\times \ora{B}&=\left|\begin{array}{ccc}\hat i & \hat j & \hat k \\ a_1 & a_2 & a_3 \\ b_1 & b_2 & b_3\end{array}\right| \end{align} \\ %text If the angle $\theta$ between the vectors is known, then the magnitude of the product can be established by the following equation, % \begin{align} |\ora{A}\times \ora{B}|=|\ora{A}||\ora{B}|\sin\theta \end{align} \\ %text Note: Unlike a vector dot product, the result of a vector cross product is also a vector. %
